titleStmt.title: Gädlä ḥawaryat, Apocryphal Acts of the Apostles

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / beta maṣāḥǝft

msItem.title: I. Gädlä Ḥawaryat, Apocryphal Acts of the Apostles
msItem.incipit: Fol. 2ra (Discourse of Dionysius on the Martyrdom of Sts. Peter and Paul): በስመ፡ʼʼ… ፍናዌ፡ መልእክት፡ ዘቅዱስ፡ ወክቡር፡ ድዮናስዮስ፡ አርዮስ፡ ፋጎስ፡ ኀበ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ጢሞቴ[ዎስ]: ፈነዎ፡ ረድኡ፡ ለጳው[ሎ]ስ፡ ኅሩይ፡ በእንተ፡ ፍጻሜ፡ ስምዖመ፡ ለጴጥሮስ፡ ወጳውሎስ፡ ፍንዋን፡ ላእካን፡ ወንጹሐን፡ በሀገረ፡ ሮምያ፡ አመ፡ [n.l.]ለሐምሌ፡ በሰላመ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ አብ፡ አሜን፨…Fol. 2ra (Discourse of Dionysius on the Martyrdom of Sts. Peter and Paul): In the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit, one God, the epistle which saint and honored Dionysius, the Areopagite, sent to St. Timothy, the disciple of Paul the elect, concerning the conclusion of the martyrdom of Peter and Paul, sent and pure messengers in the city of Rome (Romya) on [n.l.] of Ḥamle, in the peace of God, the Father. Amen. ...
msItem.explicit: Fol. 118vb, l.5 (The Preaching of St. Judas Thaddeus): … አመ፡ ፪ለወ[ር]ኀ፡ ሐምሌ፡ እንዘ፡ ይሴ[ብ]ሕ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን። (Colophon) ተፈጸመ፡ በዝየ፡ ገድል፡ ዘ[n.l.]ወ፪ሐዋርያት፡ ወ፸ወ፪፡ [አር]ድእት፡ ጸለዩ፡ ወይቤሉ፡ ንሕነ፡ ጻመውነ፡ ወተቀሰፍነ፡ በእንተ፡ ስምከ፡ ምንተ፡ ዐስብነ፡ ወይቤሎሙ፡ እግዚእነ፡ በደኃሪተ፡ ዕለት፡ ኅለፉ፡ በግህደት፡ ወይቤሉ፡ ዘይትአመን፡ በጸሎትነ፡ ወይገብር፡ ተዝከረነ፡ ወዘአጽሐፈ፡ መጽሐፈነ፡ ምንት፡ ዐስቡ፡ ወይቤሉ፡[sic] ይሕ[ል]ፍ፡ ምስሌክሙ፡ በግህደት፡ በደኃሪት፡ ዕለት፡ እስከ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ ወአሜን፡Fol. 118vb, l.5 (The Preaching of St. Judas Thaddeus): … on the second day of the month Ḥamle, glorifying the Father, and the Son and the Holy Spirit. Forever and ever. Amen. (Colophon) Here the Vitae of 12 Apostles of 72 Disciples is completed. [They] prayed and said: “We have toiled and we were tortured for Your name; which is our reward?” And our Lord said to them: “You should pass in the openness at the last day”. And they said: “Which is the reward for the one whom is trust in our prayer and makes our commemoration and for the one who caused the book to be written?”. And He said: “He should pass with you in the openness at the last day”. Forever and ever. Amen. Amen.

note.p: For each text, the equivalent pages of Budge's Edition (BConAp I, II) and the abbreviations used by Bausi in Annali 2000-2001 are given here following:
I-1) BConAp I, 50-66; BConAp II, 42-57; Dio in BauGaH
I-2) BConAp I, 3-6; BConAp II, 2-3; Int in BauGaH
I-3) BConAp I, 7-36; BConAp II, 5-25; Pt1 in BauGaH
I-4) BConAp I, 37-41, 45-49; BConAp II, 26-34; Pt2 in BauGaH
I-5) BConAp I, 42-45; BConAp II, 35-39; Pa1 in BauGaH
I-6) BConAp I, 67-70; BConAp II, 58-61; Si1 in BauGaH
I-7) BConAp I, 70-72; BConAp II, 62-64; Si2 in BauGaH
I-8) BConAp I,189-213; BConAp II,186-211; Jo1 in BauGaH
I-9) BConAp I,93-100; BConAp II, 87-92; Ba2 in BauGaH
I-10) BConAp I, 184-88; BConAp II, 181-85; An2 in BauGa
I-11) BConAp I, 225-42; BConAp II, 223-40; Ma1 in BauGaH
I-12) BConAp I, 119-25; BConAp II, 115-21; Luc in BauGaH
I-13) (BConAp I, 101-13; BConAp II,93-114; Mt1 in BauGaH)
I-14) BConAp I, 73-76; BConAp II, 65-68; Jc1 in BauGaH
I-15) BConAp I, 76-82; BConAp II, 69-75; Jc2 in BauGaH
I-16) BConAp I, 83-92; BConAp II, 76-86; Ba1 in BauGaH
I-17) BConAp I, 135-39; BConAp II, 131-36; Ph2 in BauGaH
I-18) BConAp I, 140-56; BConAp II, 137-53; An1 in BauGaH
I-19) BConAp I, 156-83; BConAp II, 154-85; AnB in BauGaH
I-20) BConAp I, 126-34; BConAp II, 122-30; Ph1 in BauGaH
I-21) BConAp I, 184-88; BConAp II, 181-85; An2 in BauGaH
I-22) BConAp I, 214-22; BConAp II, 212-20; Jo2 in BauGaH
I-23) BConAp I, 223-24; BConAp II, 221-22; JcA in BauGaH
I-24) BConAp I, 225-42; BConAp II, 223-40; Ma1 in BauGaH
I-25) BConAp I, 247-53; BConAp II, 246-52; JZ1 in BauGaH
I-26) BConAp I, 254-57; BConAp II, 253-56; JZ2 in BauGaH
I-27) BConAp I, 257-64; BConAp II, 257-64; Mar in BauGaH
I-28) BConAp I, 265-87; BConAp II, 265-86; Th1 in BauGaH
I-29) BConAp I, 287-95; BConAp II, 287-95; Th2 in BauGaH
I-30) BConAp I,296-306; BConAp II,296-306; Jud in BauGaH.
- Text I-10: text missing before fol. 37ra = BConAp I,184-187l.17.

- According to the distribution of the texts, the Gädlä ḥawaryat ofDZ-004would belong to II recension (cp. BauGaH, 83-84). However, Text I-4, the Martyrdom of St. Peter, contains the "Discourse of Peter on the Cross" (= BConAp I, 45-49; BConAp II, 30-34). On the Discourse, cp. BauGaH 84-86.

msItem.note: - Between Texts I-1 and I-2 the text divider is missing.

list.item: Since the leaves are mostly separated, it is difficult to understand the structure of quires and their number. The only indications, though insufficient, are two quire marks on fol. 18r (፫ “3”) and on fol. 26r (፬ “4”). Fol. 119 is a rejected leaf originationg from a different Ms. (Gǝbrä Ḥǝmamat; 16th cent.?)

supportDesc.condition: The binding is disintegrated; the front cover is missing. Some leaves are missing (at least between fols. 36v and 37r).

layout.ab: On average, the number of the lines to a folio is 30/31.
The upper line is written below the ruling (in some cases also above it).
The bottom line is written above the ruling.
On some leaves, writing rulings are continued beyond A vertical line, towards the ruling pricks (irregularly; s., e.g. fols. 78r, 89r).
One or two ruled lines have been left empty at the bottom, on fols. 64v-69v, and at the top, on fol. 28r (space for ornamental band).

list.item: II. Four dot asterisk (used throughout the text);
nine dot asterisk (used throughout the text);
doubled nine dot asterisks, with lines in between (esp. fols.: 25ra, l.23; 39va, l.22; 42ra, l.9);
doubled colon, with lines in between (esp. fol. 38ra, l.3).
Sentence dividers are accompanied by the paragraph signs, on the left from the text column and between the two columns (used throughout the text).
III. Nine dot asterisks, connected with lines (e.g. fols.: 25ra, l.33; 36vb, l.38; 59vb, l.24; 118vb, l.22);
chain of black lines and red and black dots (e.g. fols.: 9vb, l.12; 25ra, ls. 18, 23; 35ra, l.1; 41ra, l.7; 96ra, l.1);
chain of coronis signs, between a chain of double black lines (filled red in between) and nine dot asterisks, and a chain of double black lines and four dot asterisks (esp. fol. 37vab);
chain of coronis signs, between a chain of double black lines and nine dot asterisks, and a chain of black lines and dots (esp. fol. 59vb);
Coronis (e.g. fols.: 35ra, l.1; 37vab; 45va, l.1; 46va, l.14; 79vb, l.22);
Crux ansata with coronis, marking the beginning of each new text (esp. fols.: 25rb, l.1; 100va, l.15).

handDesc.handNote: The handwriting is characterized by uniform, rounded, curved and slightly right-sloping letters. A few letters appear more angular, e.g., መ ዐ.
- ጵ has the 6th order marker set up on the vertical stroke at the top, oriented to the left (e.g., fol. 19vb l.22);
- ሎ has sometimes the 7th order marker attached directly at the body of the letter, without horizontal stroke (e.g., fol. 14ra l.8);
- መ has the upper horizontal stroke, in the 1st and in the 2nd orders, slightly slanted to the left; besides, the right loop does not rest on the ruled line;
- ኴ has the loop marking the 5th order open (e.g., fol. 25ra l.30);
- ፬ is triangular and down wards-oriented (e.g., fol. 11ra l.20);
- ፮ is with the loop open, looking like “compressed” ፯ (e.g., fol. 84vb l.22);
- ፪ has angular and not separated loops (e.g., fol. 18ra l.15).

decoDesc.decoNote: - Fol. 2r: coloured (red, yellow, black), horizontal and vertical ornamental band, framing all the text, above, around both lateral sides, between the two columns, below the text. Geometric motifs (interlaces).
- Fol. 10r: simple, narrow, uncoloured (red), horizontal band (within the columns ab) dividing two different texts. Geometric motifs (interlaces).

list.item: Fol. 73va: Note concerning a church feast (?)Fol. 37va (below the text): ዘገነተ፡ ማርያም፡ ግበሮ፡ ተስከ፡ ደቅቀ፡ በኀምሊ[sic]፡ አ፲ወ፸፨ ዘይኮን

Fol. 118vb: Unclear note.Fol. 118vb (below the text): በጠጁን፡ ከረዙን፡ እኑሆን፯፯፡ [n.l.]በል፡ ምዕደንግያ፡ ወሚመ፡ በዘ፡ ትትከል፡ ዕዕ፡ ዘኢያንቀበቅል፡ ድማም፡
Crudely written.

- A few times, part of the lines (usually the last letter of a word) from the incipit of the texts are written at the margin, outside the column: e.g., fols. 39va, 48vb, 79vb, 60ra. - Corrections over erasures: fols. 24ra, 31ra, 32vb, 38rb, 104va. - Erasures: fols. 36vb, 41ra. - Cues for the rubricator (numbers) written in the margins of the column: e.g., fols. 39v, 59v. - Crude notes in pen or in pencil on fols. 7v (above the text), 8v (above the text), 9r (above the text) and on the right inner board.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards (the front board is missing; the back board is broken and repaired). Two pairs of sewing stations (only a few remains of the threads are visible).

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.
